cs.DM, cs.FL, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.CR

The paper deals with the problem of avoiding squares in infinite words, which is a topic in discrete mathematics (cs.DM). It also involves the use of information theory (cs.IT) to derive lower bounds on the number of solutions. The paper may also be relevant to the study of formal languages (cs.FL) and computational complexity (cs.CC), as it discusses the existence of certain languages and the difficulty of verifying their existence. Finally, the paper involves some cryptography-related concepts, such as the avoidance of patterns, which could make it relevant to the cryptography and security sub-category (cs.CR).
